result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Mario Peterson

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Anthony Mario Peterson in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Anthony Mario Peterson.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim 1, Kyle Davis, or Cory Dieryck. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:36 PM Defendant Anthony Mario Peterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Hoffman makes special appearance with Defendant. Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, asks for preliminary hearing.
State requests $7,500 cash, with conditions of no contact with Victim 1, Kyle Davis, or Cory Dieryck, no drugs. Cites priors.
Attorney Hoffman indicates lifelong resident of St. Louis County, MN. Can possibly post $1000. 
Court orders $5000 cash, with conditions of no contact with Victim 1, Kyle Davis, or Cory Dieryck, no use or possession of drugs or drug related paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
